content: What Will Your New Year's Resolutions Be?

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div span
content: About 100 Million American's make New Year's resolutions each year; 37% of those people will have broken their resolution within the first 2 months of the new year. The more thought you put into your resolutions, and the more confident you are that you can stick to your resolution, the more likely you are to keep your resolution throughout the coming year.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: Check as many boxes as are applicable, and feel free to add your comments about your resolutions, and how you intend to keep them.

content: Scams abound, and if you're going to be working to eliminate debt and/or repair your credit next year, you'll need to be aware of how to avoid being scammed. Be suspicious of any offer that asks you to pay money up front, guarantees results that seem too good to be true, or just sets off your personal warning system.

content: Lowering Your Credit Card Interest Rate

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div span
content: With only a few more days left in the holiday shopping season, it's likely that your credit card is getting a work out. The average consumer will spend around $700 this year on gifts; by making only the minimum payment on that $700 at an interest rate of 18% you could take up to 118 months (that's nearly 10 years) to pay off the debt and pay an estimated $665 in interest.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: If you are unable to pay your balance in full, you can avoid holiday hangover and get your holiday bills paid off sooner by calling your credit card company and asking them to

content: Gift Cards May Not Be The Perfect Gift

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div span
content: Gift cards can be a great gift for someone who is hard to buy for, or for whom shipping gifts is expensive or impractical. Unfortunately, gift cards aren't always the perfect gift as many come with fees and restrictions that make the gift a headache for the recipient.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span
content: If you're shopping for a gift card this holiday season, make sure you're aware of any

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p a span

content: You have several delinquent revolving accounts.

content: You have maxed out all of your credit limits.

content: You take cash advances to pay your credit card bills.

content: I was watching my local news last week, and one of the stories reported was about gift card scams that retailers are working to combat.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div p span

html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: Buy gift cards directly from the store or the retailer's secure website.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: Don't purchase the first card hanging on the rack; if possible, get one from a location that's inaccessible to the general public.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: Don't purchase a card that appears to have been tampered with, or has the PIN/password exposed.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: Ask the cashier to scan the card after you've purchased it to confirm the card's balance reflects the amount of money you asked to have loaded on the card.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td div div ul li span
content: Keep your receipt as proof of the time, location and amount for which the gift card was purchased.
